title: Infrastructure-Debt Strategies Rise as Interest Rates Remain Low
sub_head: Infrastructure-debt fund managers world-wide raised $20.13 billion last year, 18% more than in 2019, Preqin data show
body:
The fast growth of private markets in the past decade has boosted many asset classes, but perhaps none as much as infrastructure debt.
The business of lending to infrastructure developers was a niche market a decade ago, but today “it’s an established asset class,” said Jérôme Neyroud, head of infrastructure debt at asset manager Schroders PLC.
